content: write a python program that scrapes example.com and stores all headers in a list in a text file

```python
import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup as bs
r=requests.get("http://example.com")
s=bs(r.text,"html.parser")
with open("h.txt","w")as f:f.write(str([h.text for h in s.find_all(["h1","h2","h3","h4","h5","h6"])]))
```
write this as a unix command that runs a string python file, and instead of storing it in a text file, just print it
python -c "import requests;from bs4 import BeautifulSoup as bs;r=requests.get('http://example.com');s=bs(r.text,'html.parser');print([h.text for h in s.find_all(['h1','h2','h3','h4','h5','h6'])])"
